posts.author: InitiativeTracker
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Beholder lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with Beholder and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about Beholder?

posts.author: BarbarianBob
posts.content:
The way I understand the rules for Beholder, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around Beholder? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

When DMing, I like to use Beholder as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

posts.author: WarlocksWisdom
posts.content:
In our last session, we encountered a Beholder and tried to use balance to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how balance works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around balance? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about balance. Based on my experience, it works differently.

posts.author: DruidicDreamer
posts.content:
The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of encounter? to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

How do other DMs balance encounters that involve encounter?? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

I think the 2024 changes to encounter? make it much more balanced compared to before.
